intro: Chilmoria pentandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. Chilmoria pentandra prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
